content.description:
Aut hoc inclusiincludo, -ere, -clusi, -clusum: to enclose lignolignum, -i, n.: wood occultanturocculto, -are: to hide AchiviAchivi, -orum, m. pl. = Danai, -orum, 
aut haec inin, prep. (+ acc.): against nostros fabricata estfabricato, -are, -avi, -atum = facio, -ere machina muros, 
inspectura domos venturaque desuperdesuper, adv.: from above urbiurbi = “into the city”, 
aut aliquis latetlateo, -ere: to lie hidden  errorerror, -is, m.: deception. Equo ne credite, Teucri.
content.question: Which of the following best describes the speaker’s attitude toward the Trojan Horse?

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
